intro: Lathyrus pratensis subsp. lusseri, commonly known as the alpine vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its erect or ascending growth habit and trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically purple or pink in color, which bloom in early summer. It thrives in alpine and subalpine environments, often found on rocky slopes and meadows at high elevations. This subspecies is adapted to harsh climatic conditions and plays a role in soil stabilization and ecological succession in mountainous regions.
